class.name: SQLiteStatement
class.description: A handle to a reusable preparsed and precompiled SQL statement, designed efficient repeated execution. Typical workflow: prepare once, bind parameters, execute or step rows, reset, repeat, then [method finalize].

method.name: bind
method.description: Bind a positional parameter using zero-based parameter index.

method.name: bind_all
method.description: Bind all positional parameters in order. Extra values are ignored.

method.name: bind_named
method.description: Bind named parameters from a dictionary. Keys are passed without SQL prefixes ([code]:[/code], [code]@[/code], [code]$[/code], [code]?[/code]).

method.name: reset
method.description: Reset statement execution state so the statement can be executed again.

method.name: execute
method.description: Execute the statement until completion ([code]SQLITE_DONE[/code]). For row-producing queries this steps through all rows.

method.name: step
method.description: Perform a single SQLite step and return SQLite status code (for example [code]SQLITE_ROW[/code], [code]SQLITE_DONE[/code], or an error code).

method.name: fetch_all
method.description: Step the statement until completion and return all resulting rows as an array of dictionaries.

method.name: get_row
method.description: Return the row produced by the most recent [method step] call that returned [code]SQLITE_ROW[/code].

method.name: get_column_names
method.description: Return the statement's column names in column order.

method.name: get_parameter_count
method.description: Return the number of bind parameters defined by this statement.

method.name: finalize
method.description: Release the underlying SQLite statement resources. After finalization, the statement is no longer usable.

method.name: get_status
method.description: Return the current statement lifecycle status as one of [constant UNINITIALIZED], [constant INITIALIZED], [constant FINALIZED], or [constant CONNECTION_FINALIZED].

method.name: get_error_message
method.description: Return the latest SQLite statement/query error message.

members.member: Current statement lifecycle status. Alias for [method get_status]. Possible values are [constant UNINITIALIZED], [constant INITIALIZED], [constant FINALIZED], and [constant CONNECTION_FINALIZED].
Contains the latest SQLite statement/query error message. Alias for [method get_error_message].

constants.constant: Statement has not been initialized with a valid SQLite statement handle.
Statement is initialized and can be used.
Statement has been finalized by script code.
Statement was invalidated because the associated SQLite connection was closed.
